result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin Scott Lee

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marvin Scott Lee in court.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Marvin Scott Lee.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Marvin Scott Lee in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wynald Williamson, Milwaukee Police Department Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Marvin Scott Lee in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case scheduled for preliminary hearing. State ready to proceed. Defendant is requesting that the hearing be held in person. Defense waives time limits. Court finds good cause for adjournment and orders case adjourned for an in-person preliminary hearing.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR.35  
Defendant Marvin Scott Lee in court with attorney Thomas J McClure, appear in person.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness was not present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 050203,
Payable Number: 1009412,
Receipt Number: 22RP021623,
Amount: $20.00
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $2,500.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RDT and her children.

Defendant Marvin Scott Lee in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Marvin Scott Lee in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marvin Scott Lee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
